intro: Driessenia teysmannii, commonly known as the Malabar tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in dense forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
